properties.body:
This PR converts `camelCase` website URLs to `kebab-case` ones. This better aligns them with web standards and reduces codebase entropy in the long term. For example, `/api/uploadUserAvatar` is now `/api/upload-user-avatar`.

I have also configured [`unicorn/filename-case`](https://github.com/sindresorhus/eslint-plugin-unicorn/blob/main/docs/rules/filename-case.md) for the affected folders to make sure we keep the entropy low.
properties.title: Switch to kebab-case in site URLs

labels.name: area: dependencies
labels.description: Area: Relating to dependencies

labels.name: area: site
labels.description: Area: relates to the site at blockprotocol.org

labels.name: area: infra
labels.description: Area: relates to version control, CI, CD or IaC

repo.name: hash
repo.description: Data management, integration and modeling with blocks #

properties.body: ## 🌟 What is the purpose of this PR? Adds a block for visualising GitHub PRs. ## 🔗 Related links - #503 (Related) ## 📜 Does this require a change to the docs? - Not to my knowledge ## ⚠️ Known issues - The HASH app fails to load the block from `yarn dev` but succeeds with `yarn serve` - The block currently resolves all entities by itself, rather than relying on links in the ontology (e.g. it looks up and filters IssueEvents rather than looking for ones **linked** to a PR) - The block relies on the three entity types being available within the embedding application and finds them by expecting their titles to be `GithubPullRequest`, `GithubReview` and `GithubIssueEvent` respectively. This is necessary until types have URIs or other identifiers. ## 🐾 Next steps - Iterate on the design - Resolve entities through links - Identify EntityTypeIds through a better mechanism ## 🛡 What tests cover this? - None to my knowledge ## ❓ How to test this? ### Seeding the data - checkout `am/source-github` (#503) - Follow instructions of (#503) in **How to test this?** up until the mutations - Run mutations: - `executeGithubCheckTask` - this confirms that it’s working and that your authentication token is good - executeGithubDiscoverTask - this queries for the available datastreams and generates the types within your workspace - It is possible that this will get angry about folder structure - Edit the packages/hash/task-executor/src/tasks/source-github/secrets/catalog.json to only contain the JSON objects with the following stream names: `pull_requests`, `reviews`, `issue_events` - Run the executeGithubReadTask mutation, probably with a timestamp of a few days - Go grab a coffee (it’s only a few minutes, there are some logs in the task-executor process that will say it received messages, and then how many records it found ### Testing the Block - Swap branch back to `am/github-pr-overview-block` - In blocks/github-pr-overview run yarn build && yarn serve (the yarn dev command seems broken 🙃 ) - Test block as normal ## 📹 Demo
properties.title: Add GitHub PR Overview block

labels.name: C-dependencies
labels.description: Category: Pull requests that update a dependency file

labels.name: A-blocks
labels.description: Area: Block Protocol blocks

repo.name: hash
repo.description: Data management, integration and modeling with blocks #

properties.body:
## 🌟 What is the purpose of this PR?

<!-- Explain, at a high level, what this does and why. -->
<!-- Use the 'What does this change?' section to list more specific implementation details. -->
Currently the Block Config Menu doesn't
1. properly handle changes to properties of type "number". changes to properties get saved as a string even though the property type is a number
1. handle displaying input for properties that can either be a number or string. i.e properties with type ["number", "string"]

I noticed this when working on #515 . This PR fixes both issues 

## 🔗 Related links

<!-- Add links to any context it is worth capturing (e.g. Issues, Discussions, Discord, Asana) -->
<!-- Mark any links which are not publically accessible as _(internal)_ -->
<!-- Don't rely on links to explain the PR, especially internal ones: use the sections above -->

- [Asana task](link) _(internal)_

## 🚫 Blocked by

<!-- If the pull request is blocked by anything, list the blockers here. -->
<!-- If applicable, link to them. -->

- [ ] ...

## 🔍 What does this change?

<!-- Use a bullet list to explain your changes in more detail, if it would be helpful. -->
<!-- If applicable, link to the specific commit.-->

- Update `updateProperty` to properly handle changes when the property type is "number" or ["number", "string"]
- Render an input when the property type is an array that contains "number"

## 📜 Does this require a change to the docs?

<!-- If this adds a user facing feature or modifies how an existing feature is used, it likely needs a docs change. -->

- No
properties.title: Block Configuration Menu Updates

labels.name: A-hash
labels.description: Area: HASH workspace product

auto_merge.commit_message:
* update config menu to properly handle number property type

* update conditional in updateProperty

properties.body: Code looks good, tested and all pages / functionality working

issue.body: ## 🌟 What is the purpose of this PR? Adds a block for visualising GitHub PRs. ## 🔗 Related links - #503 (Related) ## 📜 Does this require a change to the docs? - Not to my knowledge ## ⚠️ Known issues - The HASH app fails to load the block from `yarn dev` but succeeds with `yarn serve` - The block currently resolves all entities by itself, rather than relying on links in the ontology (e.g. it looks up and filters IssueEvents rather than looking for ones **linked** to a PR) - The block relies on the three entity types being available within the embedding application and finds them by expecting their titles to be `GithubPullRequest`, `GithubReview` and `GithubIssueEvent` respectively. This is necessary until types have URIs or other identifiers. ## 🐾 Next steps - Iterate on the design - Resolve entities through links - Identify EntityTypeIds through a better mechanism ## 🛡 What tests cover this? - None to my knowledge ## ❓ How to test this? ### Seeding the data - checkout `am/source-github` (#503) - Follow instructions of (#503) in **How to test this?** up until the mutations - Run mutations: - `executeGithubCheckTask` - this confirms that it’s working and that your authentication token is good - executeGithubDiscoverTask - this queries for the available datastreams and generates the types within your workspace - It is possible that this will get angry about folder structure - Edit the packages/hash/task-executor/src/tasks/source-github/secrets/catalog.json to only contain the JSON objects with the following stream names: `pull_requests`, `reviews`, `issue_events` - Run the executeGithubReadTask mutation, probably with a timestamp of a few days - Go grab a coffee (it’s only a few minutes, there are some logs in the task-executor process that will say it received messages, and then how many records it found ### Testing the Block - Swap branch back to `am/github-pr-overview-block` - In blocks/github-pr-overview run yarn build && yarn serve (the yarn dev command seems broken 🙃 ) - Test block as normal ## 📹 Demo
issue.title: Add GitHub PR Overview block
